How to Install goldeneye on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • goldeneye

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install goldeneye on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing goldeneye on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall goldeneye in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install goldeneye, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install goldeneye Using apt

To install goldeneye in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install goldeneye using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install goldeneye

The installation of goldeneye might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install goldeneye Using apt-get

To install goldeneye using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install goldeneye.

sudo apt-get -y install goldeneye

Install goldeneye Using Synaptic

To install goldeneye using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install goldeneye on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for goldeneye. This will display the goldeneye package in the package window, now to install goldeneye, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the goldeneye package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of goldeneye.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install goldeneye Using aptitude

To install goldeneye on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of goldeneye.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install goldeneye using the command aptitude install goldeneye.

sudo aptitude -y install goldeneye

How to Upgrade goldeneye on debian

If you want to upgrade the goldeneye package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade goldeneye using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade goldeneye to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade goldeneye.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade goldeneye sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade goldeneye

Upgrade goldeneye using Aptitude

To upgrade goldeneye using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade goldeneye.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade goldeneye

Upgrade goldeneye using Synaptic

To upgrade goldeneye using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for goldeneye, now right-click goldeneye, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade goldeneye just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall goldeneye on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall goldeneye from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just goldeneye, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove goldeneye

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of goldeneye

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of goldeneye you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge goldeneye

Remove goldeneye using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall goldeneye using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for goldeneye, right-click the goldeneye package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall goldeneye click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install goldeneye on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade goldeneye using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of goldeneye then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
